page.title: 02CASTLE AS TOURIST ATTRACTION
page.content: The castle has been the focus of Portchester ever since it was built by the Romans about 285 AD. It was built as the most westerly of the Saxon Shore Forts designed to protect the South-Eastern coast from Saxon raids. Nowadays, the castle is a tourist attraction for people from far and wide. The most visited part of the castle is the castle grounds, surrounded by the finest Roman walls in North Western Europe. Apart from the tourism aspect, the grounds are also used for recreational purposes, such as sunbathing, dog walking, fishing and various ball games. Also in the grounds is the Norman village church, also a popular tourist attraction.
